TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit XmlSchemaAttribute extends System.Xml.Schema.XmlSchemaAnnotated

Docs.summary: Represents the element from the XML Schema as specified by the World Wide Web Consortium (W3C). Attributes provide additional information for other document elements. The attribute tag is nested between the tags of a document's element for the schema. The XML document displays attributes as named items in the opening tag of an element.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Attribute declarations can be present as child elements of the `schema` element (having global scope) or within complex type definitions. For complex types, attribute declarations can be present as local declarations or references to attributes with global scope. Both global and local attribute declarations have the optional type attribute that refers to an existing simple type. If the optional type attribute is not used, the attribute declaration (global or local) must define a local simple type.
## Examples The following example creates the `attribute` element.
[!code-cs[Classic WebData XmlSchemaAttribute Example#1](../../add/codesnippet/CSharp/t-system.xml.schema.xmls_9_1.cs)] [!code-cpp[Classic WebData XmlSchemaAttribute Example#1](../../add/codesnippet/CPP/t-system.xml.schema.xmls_9_1.cpp)] [!code-vb[Classic WebData XmlSchemaAttribute Example#1](../../add/codesnippet/VisualBasic/t-system.xml.schema.xmls_9_1.vb)]

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

Gets an object representing the type of the attribute based on the <xref:System.Xml.Schema.XmlSchemaAttribute.SchemaType%2A> or <xref:System.Xml.Schema.XmlSchemaAttribute.SchemaTypeName%2A> of the attribute.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This property is a post-schema-validation infoset property.

Attribute.AttributeName: System.Obsolete("This property has been deprecated. Please use AttributeSchemaType property that returns a strongly typed attribute type. http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=14202")

Docs.summary: Gets the common language runtime (CLR) object based on the <xref:System.Xml.Schema.XmlSchemaAttribute.SchemaType%2A> or <xref:System.Xml.Schema.XmlSchemaAttribute.SchemaTypeName%2A> of the attribute that holds the post-compilation value of the property.
Docs.value: The common runtime library (CLR) object that holds the post-compilation value of the property.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The object can be <xref:System.Xml.Schema.XmlSchemaDatatype> if the attribute has a built-in XML Schema type or <xref:System.Xml.Schema.XmlSchemaSimpleType> if the attribute has a user-defined type. This property is a post-schema-validation infoset property.
> [!IMPORTANT] > The AttributeType property is obsolete in the 2.0 version of the .NET Framework and has been replaced by the <xref:System.Xml.Schema.XmlSchemaAttribute.AttributeSchemaType%2A> property.

Docs.returns: The common runtime library (CLR) object that holds the post-compilation value of the property.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the default value for the attribute.
Docs.value:
The default value for the attribute. The default is a null reference.
Optional.

remarks.format:
## Remarks `DefaultValue` property indicates that the attribute is to appear unconditionally in the XML document, using the supplied value whenever the attribute is not present. By default, this property is set to null to indicate that no default value is supplied for the attribute. The `fixed` and `default` properties are mutually exclusive.
Optional.
The default is null.

Docs.returns:
The default value for the attribute. The default is a null reference.
Optional.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the fixed value for the attribute.
Docs.value:
The fixed value for the attribute. The default is null.
Optional.

remarks.format:
## Remarks `FixedValue` indicates that the attribute value, if present, must equal the supplied value. By default, this property is set to null, which means that no fixed value is supplied for the attribute. The `fixed` and `default` properties are mutually exclusive.
Optional.

Docs.returns:
The fixed value for the attribute. The default is null.
Optional.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the form for the attribute.
Docs.value:
One of the <xref:System.Xml.Schema.XmlSchemaForm> values. The default is the value of the <xref:System.Xml.Schema.XmlSchema.AttributeFormDefault%2A?displayProperty=fullName> of the schema element containing the attribute.
Optional.
Docs.returns:
One of the <xref:System.Xml.Schema.XmlSchemaForm> values. The default is the value of the <xref:System.Xml.Schema.XmlSchema.AttributeFormDefault%2A?displayProperty=fullName> of the schema element containing the attribute.
Optional.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the name of the attribute.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The name must be an NCName (no-colon name) as defined in the World Wide Web Consortium (W3C) XML Namespaces specification. When an XML document is validated against a schema, each attribute in the document is validated against an `attribute` element in the schema. The `attribute` element with a `name` attribute that matches the local name of the attribute in the document is used to validate that attribute. The `Name` and `RefName` properties are mutually exclusive.
Optional.

Docs.summary: Gets the qualified name for the attribute.
Docs.value: The post-compilation value of the property.
Docs.returns: The post-compilation value of the property.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the name of an attribute declared in this schema (or another schema indicated by the specified namespace).
Docs.value: The name of the attribute declared.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The `RefName` must be a QName. The type can include a namespace prefix. The `Name` and `RefName` properties are mutually exclusive.
Optional.

Docs.returns: The name of the attribute declared.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the attribute type to a simple type.
Docs.value: The simple type defined in this schema.

remarks.format: ## Remarks `SchemaTypeName` and `SchemaType` properties cannot be set at the same time.

Docs.returns: The simple type defined in this schema.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the name of the simple type defined in this schema (or another schema indicated by the specified namespace).
Docs.value: The name of the simple type.

remarks.format:
## Remarks `SchemaTypeName` and <xref:System.Xml.Schema.XmlSchemaAttribute.SchemaType%2A> properties cannot be set at the same time. The type must be a QName. The type can include a namespace prefix.
Optional.

Docs.returns: The name of the simple type.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets information about how the attribute is used.
Docs.value:
One of the following values: None, Prohibited, Optional, or Required. The default is Optional.
Optional.

remarks.format:
## Remarks If specified, this attribute must have one of the values shown in the following table.
|Enum|Description| |----------|-----------------| |`None`|Attribute has no value.| |`Prohibited`|Attribute cannot be used.| |`Optional`|Attribute is optional and may have any value. This is the default.| |`Required`|Attribute must appear once.|

Docs.returns:
One of the following values: None, Prohibited, Optional, or Required. The default is Optional.
Optional.
